typical working electrode preparation was as follows: 10 mg of powder sample and 5 mg of PVP are dispersed into a mixed solution of 1 mL of ethanol and 20 L of oleic acid, and then was ultrasonicated for 20 min to obtain a uniform suspension.Then, 40 L of suspension was deposited on the FTO glass substrate, and the coated area was 11 cm 2 .Finally, the coated FTO glass was dried at 80 C. The counter and the reference electrodes were Pt wire and AgAgCl, respectively.With 300 W Xe arc lamp ( 400 nm) as the

(NBeT Group Corp, China) and a 400 nm cut-off filter were used to simulate a visible light source.The reactor was positioned 10 cm below the simulated light source to participate in the photocatalytic reaction.In the photocatalysis process, gas products were extracted every hour.The gas products were detected by a gas chromatograph (CEAULIGHT GC-7920) equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) and a flame ionization detector (FID).

57,88.In conclusion, the introduction of surface nitrogen defects and the interfacial structure between MgAl LDO and N v -CN facilitate rapid carrier transfer and inhibit the recombination of photogenerated electron-holes, thus improving the photocatalytic activity of the catalyst. Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.

Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']

on thorough analysis of the above results, a possible reaction mechanism of the MgAl LDON v -CN photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was proposed and practically described in Fig. 6.In the photocatalytic system, CO 2 molecules first diffused onto the surface of MgAl LDON v -CN, and then, CO 2 molecules are adsorbed by Lewis base sites on the MgAl LDO surface in the form of chemisorption (Fig. 6).Simultaneously, the H 2 O molecules were adsorbed and activated to H 2 O (ad.) at the Lewis acidic sites of MgAl

Conversion of CO 2 to CO from solar energy on semiconductors is a promising route to renewable energy, but their practicality is limited by the poor adsorption and activation of CO 2 on the semiconductor surface and the low utilization of photovoltaic carriers.Here, we construct a MgAl layered double oxidenitrogen-deficient carbon nitride (MgAl LDON v -CN) nanosheets hybrid by in situ deposition of MgAl layered double hydroxide (MgAl LDH) on N v -CN nanosheets followed by subsequent calcination.The MgAl
